qas.question: What Somali polity of the Middle Ages was known for its fortresses?
What state employed Abmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi?
What was another name by which Abmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi was known?
What Somali leader received tribute from the Omani empire?

context: In the Middle Ages, several powerful Somali empires dominated the regional trade including <a0_0>the Ajuran Sultanate<a0_0/>, which excelled in hydraulic engineering and fortress building, <a1_0>the Sultanate of Adal<a1_0/>, whose general Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi (<a2_0>Ahmed Gurey<a2_0/>) was the first commander to use cannon warfare on the continent during Adal's conquest of <a3_0>the Ethiopian Empire<a3_0/>, and the Sultanate of the Geledi, whose military dominance forced governors of the Omani empire north of the city of Lamu to pay tribute to the Somali <a4_0>Sultan Ahmed Yusuf<a4_0/>.
